metadata.title: CVE-2020-12405 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
When browsing a malicious page, a race condition in our SharedWorkerServicecould occur and lead to a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerabilityaffects Thunderbird < 68.9.0, Firefox < 77, and Firefox ESR < 68.9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12405` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 77.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required
